commentBody:
If you changed the names and location, the author could be writing about the rise of Trumpism in the United States. The same themes repeat: base of support among citizens in rural areas, nostalgia for some idyllic past, pairing of government with religious dogma and glorification of national identity. And the reason for the rise of authoritarianism: the "elites" who have sold out and are not putting our country and our needs and wants first, and of course, globalization is the enemy.

It is stunning how rapid is the shift from messy, imperfect democracy can move to authoritarianism.
